H0.text: Which Japanese company has bought Horizon Nuclear Power and so has the contract to build nuclear power stations in Britain from 2015. Toshiba

H1.text: Which Japanese company has bought Horizon Nuclear Power and so has the contract to build nuclear power stations in Britain from 2015. Mitsubishi Heavy Industries

H2.text: Which Japanese company has bought Horizon Nuclear Power and so has the contract to build nuclear power stations in Britain from 2015. Fuji Electric

H3.text: Which Japanese company has bought Horizon Nuclear Power and so has the contract to build nuclear power stations in Britain from 2015. 日立

A4.text: In October 2012, Hitachi agreed to acquire the United Kingdom-based nuclear energy company Horizon Nuclear Power, which plans to construct up to six nuclear power plants in the UK, from E.ON and RWE for £700 million.

A5.text: Hitachi also owns Horizon Nuclear Power, which was originally expected to construct nuclear power stations in the United Kingdom under a British government contract, but later withdrew from these projects after investing nearly £2 billion.

A6.text: In January 2016, Hitachi announced a new UK company, Hitachi Nuclear Energy Europe, to lead a proposed joint venture with Bechtel and JGC Corporation, to cover the engineering, procurement and construction of Horizon's nuclear plants in the UK.
